intro: Raphionacme decolor, commonly known as the pale raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
